ctk_ppm.h File Reference

Definitions for handling PPM files with various alignment options. (mainly for testings). More...

#include "ctk_image.h"

Go to the source code of this file.

Defines

#define CTK_PPM_P3   "P3"
#define CTK_PPM_P6   "P6"

Functions

int ctk_ppm_p6_read (ctk_image_t *img, const char *fname)

int ctk_ppm_p6_write (ctk_image_t *img, const char *fname)

Detailed Description

Definitions for handling PPM files with various alignment options. (mainly for testings).

Note:
This module does not have any relationship to Cell.

Function Documentation

int ctk_ppm_p6_read ( ctk_image_t *  img,
const char *  fname 
)

Reads the PPM(P6) image from the input file specified by fname, allocates a image buffer in the given image structure and fills it.

Parameters:
[in] img - pointer of the image structure to be filled. The image buffer in the image structure will be allocated by the callee.
[in] fname - the file name to be read.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno otherwise.

int ctk_ppm_p6_read_align ( ctk_image_t *  img,
const char *  fname,
int  xoffset,
int  align_of_line,
int  bytes_per_pixel,
int  align_of_buf 
)

Reads the PPM(P6) image from the input file specified by fname, allocates an aligned image buffer in the given image structure and fills it.

Parameters:
[in] img - pointer of the image structure to be filled. The image buffer in the image structure will be allocated by the callee.
[in] fname - the file name to be read.
[in] xoffset - number of pixels offset in X direction
[in] align_of_line - an alignment for line size (must be power of 2).
[in] align_of_pixel - an alignment for pixel size (musg be power of 2).
[in] align_of_buf - an alignment for buffer size (must be power of 2). The allocated buffer size will be multiple of this value.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno otherwise.

int ctk_ppm_p6_write ( ctk_image_t *  img,
const char *  fname 
)

Writes out the PPM(P6) image to the output file specified by fname.

Parameters:
[in] img - the image structure to be written.
[in] fname - the file name to be written.
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno otherwise.
